passage_text: circulation of money meaning, circulation of money definition | English Cobuild dictionary. circulate. 1 verb If a piece of writing circulates or is circulated, copies of it are passed round among a group of people.

money supply. the amount of MONEY in circulation in an economy. Money supply can be specified in a variety of ways (see Fig. 127 ), and the total value of money in circulation depends on which definition of the money supply is adopted.

The definition of currency is the money system used in a country, especially paper money. An example of currency is the American dollar or the Euro. pl. -Â·cies. a continual passing from hand to hand, as of a medium of exchange; circulation. â the money in circulation in any country; often, specif., paper money.

Freebase(0.00 / 0 votes)Rate this definition: Currency. A currency in the most specific use of the word refers to money in any form when in actual use or circulation, as a medium of exchange, especially circulating paper money.

A currency (from Middle English: curraunt, in circulation, from Latin: currens, -entis) in the most specific use of the word refers to money in any form when in actual use or circulation as a medium of exchange, especially circulating banknotes and coins.ther definitions of the term currency are discussed in their respective synonymous articles banknote, coin, and money. The latter definition, pertaining to the currency systems of nations, is the topic of this article.

A currency (from Middle English: curraunt, in circulation, from Latin: currens, -entis) in the most specific use of the word refers to money in any form when in actual use or circulation as a medium of exchange, especially circulating banknotes and coins. more general definition is that a currency is a system of money (monetary units) in common use, especially in a nation. Under this definition, British pounds, U.S. dollars, and European euros are examples of currency.

Definition of Currency. Any kind of money that is in public circulation and used as a medium of exchange to facilitate the transfer of goods and services.Currencies vary across countries and include the dollar, euro, pound, and yen.ny kind of money that is in public circulation and used as a medium of exchange to facilitate the transfer of goods and services.

Definition: An uncirculated coin refers to the condition of a coin that indicates that it has never circulated in the regular money supply in the economy.In other words, the coin shows no signs of wear on any of its surfaces.mage Courtesy of: Heritage Auction Galleries, Ha.com. Definition: An uncirculated coin refers to the condition of a coin that indicates that it has never circulated in the regular money supply in the economy. In other words, the coin shows no signs of wear on any of its surfaces.
Definition of monetary. : of or relating to money or to the mechanisms by which it is supplied to and circulates in the economy a crime committed for monetary gain a government's monetary policy.

Definition of Monetary Policy. Monetary Policy is a strategy used by the Central Bank to control and regulate the money supply in an economy. It is also known as credit policy. In India, the Reserve Bank of India looks after the circulation of money in the economy.

Definition of M0, M1, M2, M3, M4. Different measures of money supply. Not all of them are widely used and the exact classifications depend on the country. M0 and M1, also called narrow money, normally include coins and notes in circulation and other money equivalents that are easily convertible into cash.ot all of them are widely used and the exact classifications depend on the country. Definition: An uncirculated coin refers to the condition of a coin that indicates that it has never circulated in the regular money supply in the economy. In other words, the coin shows no signs of wear on any of its surfaces.mage Courtesy of: Heritage Auction Galleries, Ha.com. Definition: An uncirculated coin refers to the condition of a coin that indicates that it has never circulated in the regular money supply in the economy. In other words, the coin shows no signs of wear on any of its surfaces.

The amount of money in an economy at a given moment. There are various ways in which the money supply can be defined. Narrowly defined, the money supply can mean the coins and bank notes in circulation and bank deposits where money can be withdrawn at short notice. A broader definition will also include savings accounts at banks and possibly bonds and shares.

Definition of finance. 1  1 finances plural : money or other liquid resources of a government, business, group, or individual The library closed due to a lack of finances. 2  2 : the system that includes the circulation of money, the granting of credit, the making of investments, and the provision of banking facilities.

Legal Definition of finance. 1  1 pl : money or other liquid resources of a government, business, group, or individual. 2  2 : the system that includes the circulation of money, the granting of credit, the making of investments, and the provision of banking facilities. 3  3 : the science or study of the management of funds.

DEFINITION of 'Currency'. A generally accepted form of money, including coins and paper notes, which is issued by a government and circulated within an economy. Used as a medium of exchange for goods and services, currency is the basis for trade.

DEFINITION of 'Demurrage'. A term used in currency trading to denote the cost of currency ownership and/or storage. It is essentially considered to be the cost of carrying money, and is in some respects considered superior to interest payments, as it stimulates currency circulation and economic growth.Next Up. term used in currency trading to denote the cost of currency ownership and/or storage. It is essentially considered to be the cost of carrying money, and is in some respects considered superior to interest payments, as it stimulates currency circulation and economic growth.
